import React, { useState } from "react" export default function About() { const [myStyle, setMyStyle] = useState({ color: "black", backgroundColor: "white", }) const [buttonText, setBtnText] = useState("Enable dark mode") const toggleStyle = () => { if (myStyle.color == "black") { setMyStyle({ color: "white", backgroundColor: "black", border: "1px solid white", }) setBtnText("Enable light mode") } else { setMyStyle({ color: "black", backgroundColor: "white", border: "1px solid black", }) setBtnText("Enable dark mode") } } return (

ABOUT US

Placeholder content for this accordion, which is intended to demonstrate the{" "} .accordion-flush class. This is the third item's accordion body. Nothing more exciting happening here in terms of content, but just filling up the space to make it look, at least at first glance, a bit more representative of how this would look in a real-world application.
) }
